section.title: Chair
section.para:
An ACM/FSG Chair position can be very rewarding but often requires the most work. In the event that another officer is busy, needs you to pick up one of their duties, or even forgets then it is your responsibilistitemty to pick up their slack.
Following is a shortened listitemst of duties that the Chair is responsible for:
First and foremost, making sure everyone else is doing their job.
Query potential speakers.
Set meeting dates/time.
Create and post meeting fliers.
Email the appropriate lists with meeting announcements.
Leading meetings and introducing speakers.

section.title: Vice Chair
section.para: In the event that the Chair cannot take care of certain tasks, be ready to pick them up! This could be anything from running a meeting to posting the flyers.
You will also assist the Chair by running meetings or introducing speakers.

section.title: Secretary
section.para:
The Treasurer is responsible for the following tasks:
At every meeting, collect a list of attendess. Give a copy to the Treasurer so they they can give it, along with the pizza receipt, to the appropriate staff member.

section.title: Treasurer
section.para:
The Treasurer is responsible for the following tasks:
Reporting the club's funds at the beginning of every meeting.
Ordering pizza for the meetings.
Making sure that there will be plates, cups, and napkins at the meeting.
Signing and keeping receipts to give to the appropriate staff member.

listitem.para: Post events on the acm website http://wvu.acm.org
Speak to the chair to gain access to the sites administration.
